comments.author: Jukka Zitting
comments.body: I can't reproduce this. It seems like a problem in the JavaCC processing. Can you send us the full output of "mvn clean package"?

comments.author: Jukka Zitting
comments.body:
The following jjtree warnings seem relevant:

Can't create output file /Users/adc/dev/jackrabbit/jackrabbit-core/target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/lucene/fulltext/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/lucene/fulltext/QueryParser.jj
Can't create output file /Users/adc/dev/jackrabbit/jackrabbit-core/target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/sql/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/sql/JCRSQL.jj
Can't create output file /Users/adc/dev/jackrabbit/jackrabbit-core/target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/XPath.jj

Can you do "touch target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/XPath.jj"?

comments.author: Alan Cabrera
comments.body: target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath is empty so the touch command fails.

comments.author: Jukka Zitting
comments.body: AFAIK touch should create the file if it doesn't exist. Can you try creating a file in that directory in some other way? I suspect that there's something wrong in your environment that prevents jjtree from creating the *.jj files.

comments.author: Alan Cabrera
comments.body: IIUC, the problem is that the intermediate directories do not exist.

comments.author: Dominique Pfister
comments.body: I had the same problem when starting with an empty .m2 repository: apparently this error occurs with  javacc plugin 2.2 only. Added an explicit version number 2.1.

comments.author: Jukka Zitting
comments.body: For the record, this problem seems related to the http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MJAVACC-29 issue introduced in the javacc plugin version 2.2

comments.author: Jukka Zitting
comments.body: Merged to the 1.3 branch in revision 609917.
